keyMoments.title: Saint Jalmack's Debut
keyMoments.description: Saint Jalmack, a Celestial Dragon, arrives in Goa Kingdom on his massive ship. As Sabo's small fishing boat crosses his path, Jalmack takes offense at a commoner daring to sail near him.
keyMoments.significance: This introduces one of the most despicable Celestial Dragons in the series.

keyMoments.title: Jalmack Shoots Down Sabo's Boat
keyMoments.description: Offended that Sabo's fishing boat crossed in front of his ship, Saint Jalmack shoots at the boat with a bazooka, claiming that anyone raising a pirate flag deserves to be treated as a criminal. The boat explodes and burns, with Sabo apparently killed in the blast.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most cruel acts by a Celestial Dragon, showcasing their complete disregard for human life and setting up Sabo's backstory.
keyMoments.quote: How dare a commoner's boat cut in front of mine! That pirate flag means you're a criminal who deserves to die!

reveals.information: A Celestial Dragon who visits Goa Kingdom
Extremely cruel and arrogant, willing to murder a child for crossing in front of his ship

keyMoments.title: Sabo Confined by His Family
keyMoments.description: After Sabo's previous escape attempt, his father Outlook III hires two bodyguards to guard Sabo and prevent him from leaving. Sabo is confined to his noble family's home against his will.
keyMoments.significance: This confinement strengthens Sabo's resolve to escape the Goa Kingdom and seek freedom.

keyMoments.title: Sabo Escapes on a Fishing Boat
keyMoments.description: Sabo fully accepts that he will never have freedom so long as he stays in Goa Kingdom. He steals a small fishing boat and sets sail on the day the Celestial Dragon is scheduled to arrive, hoisting a pirate flag to begin his life as a pirate.
keyMoments.significance: This is Sabo's declaration of freedom and his decision to leave his noble family behind forever.
keyMoments.quote: I'm setting out to sea! I'm finally free!

keyMoments.title: Sabo's Boat Destroyed by Jalmack
keyMoments.description: Offended that Sabo's fishing boat crossed in front of his ship, Saint Jalmack shoots at the boat with a bazooka. The boat explodes and burns, with Sabo apparently killed in the blast.
keyMoments.significance: This tragic event appears to kill Sabo and is one of the most pivotal moments in the backstory of the Straw Hat crew. Later revealed that Sabo survived but lost his memories.

keyMoments.title: Dragon Rescues Sabo
keyMoments.description: As Sabo's boat burns and sinks, Dragon dives into the water and rescues the heavily injured boy from drowning. Sabo is critically wounded with severe burns and on the verge of death, but Dragon saves him and brings him to the Revolutionary Army ship.
keyMoments.significance: This event saves Sabo's life and leads to him joining the Revolutionary Army. Sabo loses his memories of Luffy and Ace due to his injuries.

statusHistory.note: Appeared to die in episode 502 but was rescued by Dragon

relationships.description: Sabo is one of Luffy's sworn brothers, having exchanged sake cups with Luffy and Ace as children.
Sabo is one of Ace's sworn brothers, having exchanged sake cups with Luffy and Ace as children.
Outlook III is Sabo's biological father, a nobleman in the Goa Kingdom. Their relationship is strained as Sabo rejects the noble lifestyle.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III has Sabo confined with guards to prevent his escape.

relationships.description: Didit is Sabo's biological mother, a noblewoman in the Goa Kingdom.
Dragon rescued Sabo from drowning after Jalmack destroyed his boat, saving his life and bringing him to the Revolutionary Army.

evolutionMoments.description: Dragon rescues Sabo from the wreckage of his destroyed boat.

reveals.information: Sabo escapes from his noble family by stealing a fishing boat to become a pirate
Sabo's boat is destroyed by a Celestial Dragon, and he is rescued by Dragon

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace Fights Bluejam with Dadan
keyMoments.description: Ace refuses to run away from Bluejam and stays behind with Dadan to fight the pirate captain in the burning Gray Terminal.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Ace's bravery and pride, refusing to flee even in the face of overwhelming danger.

keyMoments.title: Ace Defeats Bluejam
keyMoments.description: After a fierce battle, Ace manages to strangle Bluejam while Dadan beats him down, successfully defeating the pirate captain.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ace's combat prowess even as a child and marks the end of the Bluejam Pirates' threat.

relationships.description: Dadan raised Ace as his guardian and mother figure. They fight together against Bluejam.

evolutionMoments.description: Ace and Dadan fight side by side against Bluejam in the burning Gray Terminal.

keyMoments.title: Dadan Stays to Fight Bluejam
keyMoments.description: When Ace refuses to flee, Dadan stays behind with him to fight Bluejam despite the dangerous fire engulfing the Gray Terminal.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Dadan's maternal protective instinct and her willingness to risk her life for Ace.

keyMoments.title: Dadan Defeats Bluejam with Ace
keyMoments.description: Dadan beats down Bluejam while Ace strangles him, successfully defeating the pirate captain together.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Dadan's strength and determination to protect her adopted sons.

relationships.description: Dadan raised Ace as his guardian and mother figure.

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan risks her life to stay and fight Bluejam alongside Ace.

relationships.description: Dadan raised Luffy as his guardian and mother figure.

name.japanese: モンキー・D・ドラゴン

keyMoments.title: Dragon Rescues Gray Terminal Residents
keyMoments.description: Dragon and the Revolutionary Army create a wind path to save the Gray Terminal residents trapped in the fire, welcoming them to join the Revolutionary Army.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Dragon's power to manipulate wind and the Revolutionary Army's mission to save the oppressed.

keyMoments.title: Dragon Rescues Sabo
keyMoments.description: Dragon dives into the water and rescues the heavily injured Sabo from drowning after Jalmack destroys his boat. He brings Sabo to the Revolutionary Army ship for treatment.
keyMoments.significance: This event saves Sabo's life and leads to him joining the Revolutionary Army, though Dragon doesn't know Sabo is his son's sworn brother.

abilities.description: Dragon creates a powerful wind that opens a path through the flames for the Gray Terminal residents to escape.

relationships.description: Dragon is Luffy's father, though they have not had much interaction.
Dragon rescued Sabo from drowning and brought him to the Revolutionary Army.

evolutionMoments.description: Dragon saves Sabo's life by rescuing him from the wreckage of his boat.

reveals.information: Dragon can manipulate wind to create paths and save people

keyMoments.title: Luffy Escapes Gray Terminal
keyMoments.description: Luffy and the rest of the Dadan Family bandits escape from the burning Gray Terminal while Dadan and Ace stay behind to fight Bluejam.
keyMoments.significance: Ensures Luffy's safety during the Gray Terminal fire.

keyMoments.title: Bluejam Fights Dadan and Ace
keyMoments.description: Bluejam confronts Dadan and Ace in the burning Gray Terminal as they refuse to flee.
keyMoments.significance: Final confrontation with the Bluejam Pirates captain.

keyMoments.title: Bluejam Defeated
keyMoments.description: Bluejam is defeated by the combined efforts of Ace and Dadan. Ace strangles him while Dadan beats him down. He is left unconscious in the flames and likely dies in the fire.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the end of Bluejam and the Bluejam Pirates as a threat.

statusHistory.note: Likely died in the Gray Terminal fire after being defeated by Ace and Dadan

name.japanese: バーソロミュー・くま

keyMoments.title: Kuma as Revolutionary Army Member
keyMoments.description: Kuma is shown alongside Dragon and Ivankov rescuing the Gray Terminal residents, revealing his role as a Revolutionary Army member in a flashback.
keyMoments.significance: First time in the anime that Kuma is shown as a member of the Revolutionary Army.

reveals.information: Kuma was a member of the Revolutionary Army 12 years ago

name.japanese: エンポリオ・イワンコフ

keyMoments.title: Ivankov Helps Rescue Gray Terminal Residents
keyMoments.description: Ivankov, alongside Dragon and Kuma, helps rescue the Gray Terminal residents by creating a wind path through the flames.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ivankov's role in the Revolutionary Army during the Goa Kingdom incident.

keyMoments.title: Outlook III Confines Sabo
keyMoments.description: Outlook III hires two bodyguards to guard Sabo and prevent him from escaping after his previous attempt to run away.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the control and oppression Sabo faces from his noble family.

relationships.description: Outlook III is Sabo's biological father.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III has Sabo confined with guards to prevent his escape.

keyMoments.title: Didit Witnesses Sabo's Departure
keyMoments.description: In an anime-original scene, Didit and her husband Outlook III witness Sabo's departure on the fishing boat, much to their shock.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the parents' reaction to Sabo's escape and final departure from the noble family.
